meanings.sent1: The clonk of the metal door closing echoed through the hallway.
meanings.sent2: I heard a clonk when the metal pipe fell on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The clonk of the coins dropping into the piggy bank made me smile.
meanings.sent4: The clonk of the hammer against the anvil signaled the start of the blacksmith's work.
meanings.sent5: The clonk of the car door shutting was the last sound before we drove away.

meanings.definition: To hit someone or something with a dull, heavy blow
meanings.sent1: He accidentally clonked his head on the low doorway.
meanings.sent2: She clonked the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent3: I playfully clonked my friend on the head with a foam sword.
meanings.sent4: The chef clonked the garlic cloves to release their flavor.
meanings.sent5: The boxer clonked his opponent with a powerful punch.

meanings.definition: A blow or hit with a dull, heavy sound
meanings.sent1: The clonk on the door startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent2: The clonk of the bat hitting the ball echoed across the field.
meanings.sent3: The clonk of the falling tree branch made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The clonk of the falling rock alerted us to danger.
meanings.sent5: The clonk of the falling book broke the silence in the library.
